> Are changes complete for this PR as this is still in draft state. Also, not sure we will eventually hit storm due to slowness in pfc frames rate. Did you see wait_until eventaully passes ? I believe we may need to somehow send higher rate of pfc frame to be able to see strom state on all ports.

Hi @vmittal-msft,
Multiple improvements have been made to the test as per our offline discussion

- Having multi-process pfc_gen helps in generating pfc on most of the ports on time. 
- Reducing the poll_interval improves the test. The poll interval is now equal to detection time (200ms) for the test. This helps in faster detection of the storms. 
- Added a threshold 75% in case 1-2 ports cannot reach stormed state due to slow fan. Since, this is a stress test, having a threshold is ok.

> I believe these settings are only applicable when using 100g speed for 400g sku. So we may need to have sku check to make sure we pick settings appropriately. Will this break 100 speed test with 100g sku ?

@vmittal-msft , as per discussion the code can be handled either by adding a new topo-type ex., 'topo_one_hwsku' where we can add all portSpeedCableLength supporting 400GHwsku with 100G ports or, the second option is to change the key value portSpeedCableLength in qos_yaml and append hwsku also in keys like from "100000_2000m" to "400G_100000_2000m".Please suggest to make the changes accordingly.

Can you please help me better understand the change?
`for Hwsku change100G to 400G` is there a specific PR you could provide that created the need to change these values?

> > I believe these settings are only applicable when using 100g speed for 400g sku. So we may need to have sku check to make sure we pick settings appropriately. Will this break 100 speed test with 100g sku ?
> 
> @vmittal-msft , as per discussion the code can be handled either by adding a new topo-type ex., 'topo_one_hwsku' where we can add all portSpeedCableLength supporting 400GHwsku with 100G ports or, the second option is to change the key value portSpeedCableLength in qos_yaml and append hwsku also in keys like from "100000_2000m" to "400G_100000_2000m".Please suggest to make the changes accordingly.

@vmittal-msft , Can you please comment on above solution.

> Can you please help me better understand the change? `for Hwsku change100G to 400G` is there a specific PR you could provide that created the need to change these values?

@peterbailey-arista this is to support 100G port speed on 400G HW SKU. Due to difference in headroom pool size between 100G & 400G SKU, the 100G port speed test may fail on 400G SKU hence this discussion.

> > > I believe these settings are only applicable when using 100g speed for 400g sku. So we may need to have sku check to make sure we pick settings appropriately. Will this break 100 speed test with 100g sku ?
> > 
> > 
> > @vmittal-msft , as per discussion the code can be handled either by adding a new topo-type ex., 'topo_one_hwsku' where we can add all portSpeedCableLength supporting 400GHwsku with 100G ports or, the second option is to change the key value portSpeedCableLength in qos_yaml and append hwsku also in keys like from "100000_2000m" to "400G_100000_2000m".Please suggest to make the changes accordingly.
> 
> @vmittal-msft , Can you please comment on above solution.

@ansrajpu-git we should use new topo-type. may be like topo-t2_single_node_hybrid ?

The area-kvmtest-t0 Azure pipeline is failing for the test case
dhcp_relay/test_dhcpv4_relay.py::test_dhcp_relay_option82_suboptions[server_id_override-sonic-relay-agent]
with the following error:

**AssertionError: Expected packet was not received on device 0, port 1.**

This failure has been observed consistently in the last two pipeline runs.

To investigate, I attempted to reproduce the issue using a local sonic-vs (t0) setup. However, the test passes successfully in the local environment.

Pass logs:
[dhcpv4_relay_vs_testcase_logs.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/24257220/dhcpv4_relay_vs_testcase_logs.zip)


The local setup was created by following the instructions provided here:
https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/docs/testbed/README.testbed.VsSetup.md

I used **Option 3: Use SONiC image as neighboring devices**, and the VS image was downloaded from the community build:
wget "https://sonic-build.azurewebsites.net/api/sonic/artifacts?branchName=master&platform=vs&target=target/sonic-vs.img.gz" -O sonic-vs.img.gz
